title: Osmosis U-Tube
summary: Explore water movement across a membrane when salt is added.

title: Physiological Solution
summary: Understand how osmotic balance affects blood cells

title: ABO Explorer
summary: Discover blood types by testing virtual blood samples and finding their antigens and antibodies.

title: Photosynthesis in Action
summary: Discover how light, carbon dioxide, temperature affect the rate of photosynthesis

title: Bone Chemical Composition
summary: Explore the chemical components of bone, including calcium salts and collagen, and how they give bones strength and flexibility

title: Potato Osmometer
summary: Investigate osmosis using a potato as a model cell to see how water moves through membranes in different solutions

title: Membrane Potential Simulation
summary: Simulate how ions move across cell membranes and create electrical charges that lead to membrane potential

title: Hershey and Chase Experiment
summary: Visualize how radioactive labeling of protein and DNA in bacteriophages proved that DNA carries genetic information, not protein

title: Meselson and Stahl Experiment
summary: Learn how DNA replication was proven to be semi-conservative

title: Louis Pasteur's Experiment
summary: Discover how Pasteur disproved spontaneous generation by showing that bacteria come from other bacteria, not from 'nothing'

title: Griffith's Transformation Experiment
summary: Explore how Frederick Griffith discovered that a 'transforming principle' could transfer genetic traits between bacteria

title: Avoidance Learning Test
summary: Understand how animals learn to avoid unpleasant stimuli by forming associations between behavior and negative outcomes

title: Forced Swim Test (FST)
summary: Study depressive-like behavior in animals by measuring their activity and immobility when placed in water

title: Mitochondrial Power
summary: Explore how mitochondria produce energy by measuring oxygen consumption and glycolysis in live cells using Seahorse XF Analyzer.

title: Protein Denaturation and Renaturation
summary: Visualize how protein structure changes under heat or pH shifts

title: Natural Selection Simulation
summary: Simulate changing environments and population adaptation where students choose traits that survive and explain why

title: Virus vs Time
summary: Connect virus incubation time with spread rate in a fun simulation where students observe how timing affects outbreak dynamics

title: Food Energy Test
summary: Measure the energy content of food by burning samples and observing how much heat is transferred to water in a calorimeter setup
